<< I was actually nervous about writing to Sandra for some Thinking sticks
because I just KNEW she would think I was a bit Neurotic (ok, I'll just admit
to it now) because my handwriting is absolutely atrocious. Scrawls in every
direction, no sense whatsoever. I figured she'd have a hay day analyzing it!!
Gulp.
ok, so the secret is out..... >>

That's terrible! I'm really sorry you felt afraid of me seeing writing. I
LOVE handwriting.

As long as you weren't an obvious leftie dotting i's with hearts, I'd be
happy.

(I just know there's a heart-dotting leftie here. And I'm joking anyway.)

Sandra

messages.msgSnippet: ... I thought it was.  I love that movie too.  My kids call it the Princess Buttercup movie or the Wesley movie.  It is very popular among many unschoolers I
messages.messageBody:
starsuncloud@... wrote:
>
> oh, and are you talking about the Inigo as in
> "ello, my name eez Inigo Montoya, you keel my fathair, preepare to die..."
> ??
> I LOVE that movie.
> Ren
>

I thought it was. I love that movie too. My kids call it the Princess
Buttercup movie or the Wesley movie. It is very popular among many
unschoolers I know. We had an unschooling family over in Nov. so their
children could see it - they don't have a TV and it doesn't play at
many movie theatres any more!

--

Cindy Ferguson
crma@...

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 88
messages.msgSnippet: Ok sistakammi, Lose the Lipfinity...sure it stays on all day, but it s hell on your lips and it doesn t look that great anyway.  And if you buy a high quality
messages.messageBody:
Ok sistakammi,
Lose the Lipfinity...sure it stays on all day, but it's hell on your lips and
it doesn't look that great anyway. And if you buy a high quality foundation
it will stay put and look great all day! Honest. But they run 28 dollars and
up for one bottle (yes, that's what I sell). It actually matches your skin
perfectly too, none of this ugly line stuff.
If you want a lipstick that is kind to your lips you will have to reapply it
occasionally. If you want stay put forever, it will dry your lips out. The
good lipsticks are 15 dollars and up (most of ours are around 18..yikes!!).
So it's not in the average SAHM's budget....but hey, I just figured out the
solution--go to work for them!! hehe

On the handwriting issue...
I was actually nervous about writing to Sandra for some Thinking sticks
because I just KNEW she would think I was a bit Neurotic (ok, I'll just admit
to it now) because my handwriting is absolutely atrocious. Scrawls in every
direction, no sense whatsoever. I figured she'd have a hay day analyzing it!!
Gulp.
ok, so the secret is out.....
I'd hate to hear what anyone would analyze from my handwritten notes.

Ren
